dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so seriously, who do you think is richer right now? Bezos or, like, someone else entirely?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so seriously, who do you think is richer right now? Bezos or, like, someone else entirely?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it has to be Bezos, right? I mean, Amazon's just, you know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it has to be Bezos, right? I mean, Amazon's just, you know.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, nope. You are wrong. Try the Waltons. The Walmart Waltons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, nope. You are wrong. Try the Waltons. The Walmart Waltons.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? No way! Bezos is like almost $160 billion!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? No way! Bezos is like almost one hundred sixty dollars billion!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of Thursday (the 16th of August), hes worth nearly $156 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but the family collectively, thanks to this crazy stock bump... they're like, over $170 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but the family collectively, thanks to this crazy stock bump... they're like, over one hundred seventy dollars billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That is just insane! For Walmart? Still? In this e-commerce world?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is just insane! For Walmart? Still? In this e-commerce world?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Their earnings report, uh, just blew Wall Street away. International sales, booming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Their earnings report, uh, just blew Wall Street away. International sales, booming.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article mentions that Walmart 'reported earnings that pleased Wall Street' but does not specify that 'international sales' were the reason.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So much for Amazon taking over literally everything, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So much for Amazon taking over literally everything, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And get this, Alice Walton? Richest woman in the world again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this, Alice Walton? Richest woman in the world again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, she beat L'Oreal? Like, wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, she beat L'Oreal? Like, wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Like, $46 billion just for her. And they're doing all this philanthropic stuff too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Like, forty six dollars billion just for her. And they're doing all this philanthropic stuff too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article confirms Alice Walton is worth $46 billion but does not mention any philanthropic activities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, art education. But the grocery thing is huge, that's where they're actually fighting Amazon, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, art education. But the grocery thing is huge, that's where they're actually fighting Amazon, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article mentions the grocery business is a 'key battleground' with Amazon, but does not mention 'art education'.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! Walmart Go, grocery delivery to 40% of America soon!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! Walmart Go, grocery delivery to forty percent of America soon!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So they're actually beating Amazon at its own game, kind of? They're adapting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they're actually beating Amazon at its own game, kind of? They're adapting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, essentially! And get this, the article says they could be the first $200 billion family.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, essentially! And get this, the article says they could be the first two hundred dollars billion family.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By our estimates, theyll be the first $200 billion family in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, stop. And they mentioned a permanent lunar research facility?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, stop. And they mentioned a permanent lunar research facility?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The provided article does not contain any information about a permanent lunar research facility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes! A permanent lunar research facility! Like, what?!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes! A permanent lunar research facility! Like, what?!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The provided article does not contain any information about a permanent lunar research facility.
